titles.title: Comment on “<math><msub><mi>η</mi><mi>c</mi></msub></math> production in photon-induced interactions at the LHC”

copyright.statement: Published by the American Physical Society

abstracts.value: In “<math><msub><mi>η</mi><mi>c</mi></msub></math> production in photon-induced interactions at the LHC,” [Phys. Rev. D 97, 094009 (2018)] Goncalves and Moreira discuss inclusive and exclusive <math><msub><mi>η</mi><mi>c</mi></msub></math> production at <math><mi>p</mi><mi>p</mi></math> and <math><mi>p</mi><mi>A</mi></math> collisions at LHC energies. The exclusive channels are via two-photon and photon-Odderon interactions. This comment points out that there is a large additional source of almost-exclusive <math><msub><mi>η</mi><mi>c</mi></msub></math> in ultraperipheral collisions: from the radiative decay of <math><mi>J</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>ψ</mi></math> that are produced in photon-nucleon interactions. Although the <math><mi>J</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>ψ</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>γ</mi><msub><mi>η</mi><mi>c</mi></msub></math> branching ratio is small, the <math><mi>J</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>ψ</mi></math> production cross-section is large enough that it dominates over the exclusive channels considered in [1], and is comparable to the nonexclusive production. In <math><mi>J</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>ψ</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>γ</mi><msub><mi>η</mi><mi>c</mi></msub></math>, the photon is very soft and therefore easy to miss, and the <math><msub><mi>η</mi><mi>c</mi></msub></math> will have very similar kinematics to the <math><mi>J</mi><mo>/</mo><mi>ψ</mi></math>.
